ovdesc.p: CRS.PARAMETER table is used to record the details of the institutionâ€™s agreement with the regulation, for example the effective date of the CRS provisions, participating jurisdictions and certain default conditions.
CRS.PARAMETER is a customer company level parameter table.

desc.p: ID is the company code for which the record belongs.
The CRS.PARAMETER table is a customer level company table. The item id to the parameter record must exist as a valid company code on the company file
Validation rules
Up to 11 Alphanumeric characters. Should be a valid Company Code.
Field to identify the effective date of the CRS regulation.
Used to identify the customers as existing or new based on this date.
Validation rules
Mandatory field.
Standard date format -(YYYYMMDD)
Field specifies the countries which are participating with the regulatory requirements.
Associate multi-value field with the TELEPHONE.CODE field and either both the field values should be present or blank.
Validation rules
Should be a valid country present in the T24 COUNTRY table.
If value is present in this field, then the corresponding country TELEPHONE.CODE is mandatory.
Field to hold the telephone code of the corresponding PARTNG.JURIDICTION.
Associate multi-value field with the PARTNG.JURIDICTION field and either both the field values should be present or blank.
Validation rules
Should start with '+' or '00'.
If value is present in this field, then the corresponding PARTNG.JURIDICTION country is mandatory.
The logic to calculate the Indicia required or not along with the reportable jurisdiction will be built into the API that is specified in this field.
However, if the banks want to use a different logic, then they can plug in their local APIs.
If no routine is attached here, the INDICIA, REPORTABLE.JUR and CRS.STATUS will not be calculated.
Validation rules
Should be a valid EB.API record.
Field to decide whether the previous day customer balances should be calculated when the CRS.STATUS is changed to INACTIVE in CRS.CUST.SUPP.INFO table.
By default system calculates balance aggregation every month end.
If set as none or previous month, then system uses the default calculated balance.
Validation rules
Allowed values are PREVIOUS.MONTH, PREVIOUS.DAY.
Field to specify the currency to be used for Balance aggregation process.
If no value is specified, system calculates the aggregation balance in local currency of the corresponding company.
Validation rules
Should be a valid currency.
Field to identify whether the initial balance aggregation process is performed for all the existing customers.
System will update this field as 'YES', once the initial aggregation is completed.
Once the field is set, then the subsequent aggregation process will be performed only for the customer having CRS.CUST.SUPP.INFO records.
Validation rules
No input field.
Field to specify whether to recalculate the INDICIA, REPORTABLE.JUR and CRS.STATUS in CRS.CUST.SUPP.INFO, whenever there is a change in PARTICIPANT.JUD or TELEPHONE.CODE of CRS.PARAMETER.
Only when set to 'YES', status will get recalculated for all the CRS.CUST.SUPP.INFO records.
Validation rules
Allowed values are YES, NO.
Field to specify the different account types which are used for the classification of existing accounts.
Fields ACCOUNT.TYPE, ACCOUNT.SUB.TYPE, BAL.AMT.AGGR.FROM, BAL.AMT.AGGR.TO, DUE.DILIGENCE.DATE, REPORTING.DATE form an associated multi-value set.
Validation rules
Allowed values are NEW.INDIVIDUAL, NEW.ENTITY, PRE-EXISTING.INDIVIDUAL PRE-EXISTING.ENTITY
Field to specify the further classification of the account type such as HIGH or LOW. Based on this, balance aggregation will be performed.
Fields ACCOUNT.SUB.TYPE, BAL.AMT.AGGR.FROM, BAL.AMT.AGGR.TO, DUE.DILIGENCE.DATE and REPORTING.DATE form an associate sub-value set.
Validation rules
Allowed values are HIGH, LOW.
Allowed to define only for PRE-EXISTING account types.
Used to hold the lower range of the aggregation amount for the corresponding ACCOUNT.TYPE, which will be used during account classification for the existing accounts.
Validation rules
Allowed to define only for PRE-EXISTING account types.
Used to hold the upper range of the aggregation amount for the corresponding ACCOUNT.TYPE, which will be used during account classification for the existing accounts.
Validation rules
Allowed to define only for PRE-EXISTING account types.
Field to specify the Due-diligence dates for the account types PRE-EXISTING.INDIVIDUAL.LOW, PRE-EXISTING.INDIVIDUAL.HIGH, PRE-EXISTING.ENTITY.HIGH.
Flexibility is given to define different Due Diligence Dates as and when Financial Institution residing in a particular jurisdiction comes under the purview of the regulation
Validation rules
Standard date and frequency to be given.
Field to specify the Reporting Date for the account types.
Validation rules
Allowed to define standard date and frequency.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a multi valued field.
Contains details of any override applicable to this record.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.
